summary: The capybara, found in South America, is the world's largest rodent. It lives near water in groups of 10 to 100 and is related to guinea pigs. Capybaras are social animals, enjoying the company of their kind. Humans hunt them for meat, skin, and the fat from their thick skin. These creatures can be found in various habitats, from savannas to dense forests.
title: Capybara
